pandemic.title: Pandemic
pandemic.content:
# Pandemic Preparedness

A pandemic is a global outbreak of a disease. Pandemics happen when a new virus emerges to infect people and can spread between people sustainably.

## How to prepare

- Stock up on essential supplies (food, water, medicine)
- Follow official health guidelines
- Practice good hygiene
- Stay informed through reliable sources

## During a pandemic

- Follow social distancing guidelines
- Wear appropriate protective equipment
- Monitor your health regularly
- Support vulnerable community members

war.title: War
war.content:
# War and Conflict Preparedness

Armed conflicts can disrupt essential services and create dangerous situations for civilians.

## How to prepare

- Create an emergency plan with your family
- Prepare an emergency kit with essentials
- Know your local emergency shelters
- Keep important documents accessible

## During conflict

- Stay informed through official channels
- Follow instructions from authorities
- Avoid areas of active conflict
- Help others when it's safe to do so

flood.title: Flood
flood.content:
# Flood Preparedness

Floods can occur with little warning and can be devastating to communities.

## How to prepare

- Know if you live in a flood-prone area
- Prepare an emergency kit
- Create a family emergency plan
- Consider flood insurance

## During a flood

- Move to higher ground immediately
- Avoid walking or driving through flood waters
- Follow evacuation orders
- Turn off utilities if instructed to do so

hurricane.title: Hurricane
hurricane.content:
# Hurricane Preparedness

Hurricanes are powerful storms that can cause extensive damage through high winds, heavy rainfall, and storm surges.

## How to prepare

- Create a hurricane emergency kit
- Develop an evacuation plan
- Secure your home (board windows, secure outdoor items)
- Stay informed about weather updates

## During a hurricane

- Follow evacuation orders immediately
- If sheltering at home, stay in a small, interior room
- Stay away from windows
- Be prepared for power outages

drought.title: Drought
drought.content:
# Drought Preparedness

Droughts are extended periods of unusually low rainfall, leading to water shortages.

## How to prepare

- Implement water conservation measures
- Install water-efficient fixtures
- Collect and store rainwater when possible
- Learn about your community's water supply

## During a drought

- Follow water restriction guidelines
- Prioritize water use for essential needs
- Report water leaks promptly
- Help vulnerable community members

heatwave.title: Heat Wave
heatwave.content:
# Heat Wave Preparedness

Extreme heat can be dangerous, especially for vulnerable populations like the elderly and young children.

## How to prepare

- Install window reflectors to reflect heat back outside
- Weather-strip doors and windows
- Check air conditioning systems
- Learn about cooling centers in your area

## During a heat wave

- Stay in air-conditioned areas when possible
- Drink plenty of fluids
- Wear lightweight, light-colored clothing
- Check on vulnerable family and neighbors

forestFire.title: Forest Fire
forestFire.content:
# Forest Fire Preparedness

Forest fires can spread rapidly and threaten homes and communities near wilderness areas.

## How to prepare

- Create a defensible space around your home
- Use fire-resistant building materials
- Prepare an emergency evacuation plan
- Keep emergency supplies ready

## During a forest fire

- Follow evacuation orders immediately
- Close all windows and doors if evacuating
- Monitor air quality reports
- Stay informed through official channels

powerOutage.title: Power Outage
powerOutage.content:
# Power Outage Preparedness

Power outages can occur due to storms, equipment failures, or other emergencies.

## How to prepare

- Keep flashlights and extra batteries
- Consider a backup power source
- Have a battery-powered or hand-crank radio
- Keep mobile phones charged

## During a power outage

- Use flashlights instead of candles when possible
- Keep refrigerator and freezer doors closed
- Unplug sensitive electronics
- Check on vulnerable neighbors

waterShortage.title: Water Shortage
waterShortage.content:
# Water Shortage Preparedness

Water shortages can occur due to drought, infrastructure failures, or contamination events.

## How to prepare

- Store emergency water (1 gallon per person per day)
- Install water-efficient fixtures
- Learn how to purify water
- Know alternative water sources

## During a water shortage

- Follow water conservation guidelines
- Use water for essential needs only
- Report water main breaks
- Help vulnerable community members

cyberAttack.title: Cyber Attack
cyberAttack.content:
# Cyber Attack Preparedness

Cyber attacks can disrupt critical services and compromise personal information.

## How to prepare

- Use strong, unique passwords
- Enable two-factor authentication
- Keep software and systems updated
- Back up important data regularly

## During a cyber attack

- Disconnect affected devices from the internet
- Report suspicious activity
- Change passwords on unaffected accounts
- Monitor accounts for unauthorized activity

majorAccident.title: Major Accident
majorAccident.content:
# Major Accident Preparedness

Major accidents include industrial incidents, transportation accidents, or structural failures.

## How to prepare

- Know evacuation routes from your area
- Learn about local warning systems
- Keep emergency contact information accessible
- Prepare an emergency kit

## During a major accident

- Follow instructions from authorities
- Evacuate if instructed to do so
- Avoid the affected area
- Seek medical attention if needed

preparednessStorage.title: Preparedness Storage
preparednessStorage.content:
# Emergency Preparedness Storage

Having essential supplies stored and ready can help you and your family during emergencies.

## Basic Emergency Kit

- Water (1 gallon per person per day for at least 3 days)
- Non-perishable food (at least a 3-day supply)
- Battery-powered or hand-crank radio
- Flashlight and extra batteries
- First aid kit
- Whistle to signal for help
- Dust mask, plastic sheeting, and duct tape
- Moist towelettes, garbage bags, and plastic ties
- Wrench or pliers to turn off utilities
- Manual can opener
- Local maps
- Cell phone with chargers and a backup battery

## Additional Items to Consider

- Prescription medications and glasses
- Infant formula and diapers
- Pet food and extra water for your pet
- Important family documents in a waterproof container
- Cash or traveler's checks
- Emergency reference materials
- Sleeping bag or warm blanket for each person
- Complete change of clothing
- Fire extinguisher
- Matches in a waterproof container
- Feminine supplies and personal hygiene items
- Mess kits, paper cups, plates, paper towels, and plastic utensils
- Paper and pencil
- Books, games, puzzles, or other activities for children

afterCrisis.title: After Crisis
afterCrisis.content:
# After a Crisis

The period after a crisis can be challenging. Here's guidance on recovery and returning to normalcy.

## Immediate Steps

- Ensure your safety and the safety of those around you
- Assess for injuries and seek medical attention if needed
- Check your property for damage
- Contact family members to let them know you're safe
- Listen to official information and instructions

## Recovery Process

- Document damage for insurance purposes
- Apply for disaster assistance if applicable
- Begin clean-up when authorities indicate it's safe
- Take care of your mental health and emotional well-being
- Help others in your community when possible

## Long-term Considerations

- Review and update your emergency plan based on your experience
- Replenish emergency supplies
- Consider improvements to make your home more resilient
- Stay connected with community recovery efforts
- Prepare for future emergencies
